original: de nyid kyi khyad par phan dang thugs brtser ldan zhes bya ba ste sems can thams cad la thugs rje dang ldan pas gong ma bzhin du phan pa'i sgo nas don rtogs par mdzad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par phan dang thugs brtser ldan zhes bya ba ste sems can thams cad la thugs rje dang ldan pas gong ma bzhin du phan pa'i sgo nas don rtogs par mdzad ces pa'o //
translated: The special quality of that is ‚Äúendowed with benefit and compassion,‚Äù which means that because he is endowed with compassion for all sentient beings, he realizes the benefit of the world through the above-mentioned benefit.

original: @150a * // dgongs pa'i bya ba kun la chags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i don bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba thams cad la chags shing dang du len pa'o //
analyzed: @150a * // dgongs pa'i bya ba kun la chags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i don bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba thams cad la chags shing dang du len pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAttached to all activities of intention‚Äù means that he is attached to and accepts all activities of the world, which are to attain unexcelled enlightenment.

original: gal te mgon pos bdag srog ces pa la sogs pa ni gong ma dang 'dra bar de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par khyod bdag la kun du bzang po'i spyod pas dgyes par mdzod cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: gal te mgon pos bdag srog ces pa la sogs pa ni gong ma dang 'dra bar de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par khyod bdag la kun du bzang po'i spyod pas dgyes par mdzod cig pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the protector is pleased with me‚Äù and so forth is similar to above, meaning that you should be pleased with me, who has such qualities, through the conduct of Samantabhadra.

original: de la kun du bzang po'i spyod pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang du lan cing spyod kyang de'i nyes pas mi gos pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun du bzang po'i spyod pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang du lan cing spyod kyang de'i nyes pas mi gos pa'o //
translated: In that regard, the conduct of Samantabhadra is to accept and engage in afflictions such as desire, yet not be tainted by their faults.

original: skabs 'dir ni thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul du 'dod chags kyi spyod pa nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul du 'dod chags kyi spyod pa nyid la bya ste /
translated: Here, however, it refers to the practice of passion itself, in the manner of means and insight,

original: kun du bzang po'i tshul thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i tshul thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one attains the way of Samantabhadra.

original: rdo rje don khyod dam tshig mchog lags te //
analyzed: rdo rje don khyod dam tshig mchog lags te //
translated: You are the supreme commitment, O Vajra Meaning,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni lha mo sgrol mas bcom ldan 'das do yod grub pa la bstod cing bskul bar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni lha mo sgrol mas bcom ldan 'das do yod grub pa la bstod cing bskul bar bstan to //
translated: Here, the goddess Tara is praising and exhorting the Blessed One, the Accomplished One.

original: de la rdor je don ni dus gsum gyis sang rgyas kyi phrin las kyi rang bzhin du gnas nas sems can gyi don //
analyzed: de la rdor je don ni dus gsum gyis sang rgyas kyi phrin las kyi rang bzhin du gnas nas sems can gyi don //
translated: There, the Vajra Meaning is the nature of the deeds of the Buddhas of the three times, abiding in the benefit of sentient beings.

original: gang la ci dgongs pa bzhin du mdzad pa la chud za ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la ci dgongs pa bzhin du mdzad pa la chud za ba med pa'o //
translated: It is the non-wastage of whatever is intended for whomever.

original: de'i phyir na dam tshig mchog ste rgya mtsho bzhin du dus las mi 'da' ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir na dam tshig mchog ste rgya mtsho bzhin du dus las mi 'da' ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is the supreme commitment, meaning that it is like the ocean, never passing beyond its time.

original: phan pa'i don chen rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i rigs //
analyzed: phan pa'i don chen rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i rigs //
translated: The great benefit is the family of the perfect Buddha.

original: zhes pa ni gong ma bzhin du phan pa'i sgo nas bla na me dpa'i byang chub rtogs par mdzad cing sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'jog pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong ma bzhin du phan pa'i sgo nas bla na me dpa'i byang chub rtogs par mdzad cing sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'jog pa'i don to //
translated: This, as above, means that you have realized the unsurpassed enlightenment by way of benefit, and that you have established [sentient beings] in the path to buddhahood.

original: mnyam nyid thig le rjes su thugs brtser ldan //
analyzed: mnyam nyid thig le rjes su thugs brtser ldan //
translated: You are endowed with the compassion of the drop of equality.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i tshul gyis khyod ni sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings thob par mdzad pa'i mthu dang ldan zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i tshul gyis khyod ni sems can thams cad chos kyi dbyings thob par mdzad pa'i mthu dang ldan zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that by such a method you are endowed with the power to cause all sentient beings to attain the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: yang na mnyam nyid thig le ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: yang na mnyam nyid thig le ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Or else, the drop of equality is the bodhicitta of the nondual union of method and wisdom.

original: de las sprul pa'i sku sna tshogs su gyur nas sems can gyi don mdzad pas thugs brtser ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de las sprul pa'i sku sna tshogs su gyur nas sems can gyi don mdzad pas thugs brtser ldan pa'o //
translated: Since you emanate various nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅyas from that and perform the welfare of sentient beings, you are endowed with compassion.

original: gal te mgon pos bdag srog bzhed pa na //
analyzed: gal te mgon pos bdag srog bzhed pa na //
translated: If the protector wishes to keep me alive,

original: yon tan rin chen gter ma bdag la spyod //
analyzed: yon tan rin chen gter ma bdag la spyod //
translated: I will not use the treasure of precious qualities.

original: ces pa ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa khyod bdag yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas yon tan thams cad kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa la dgyes par spyod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa khyod bdag yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas yon tan thams cad kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa la dgyes par spyod ces pa'i don to //
translated: This means that you, who possess such qualities, are the nature of all the qualities of the Buddha, like a wish-fulfilling jewel, and I am delighted to enjoy you.

original: de ltar lha mos bskul nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar lha mos bskul nas ni //
translated: Thus, having been exhorted by the goddesses,

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i tshul dus sangs rgyas spyad la sogs pa'i lha @150b mo bzhis so so'i rigs kyi bdag po la bskul ma thag so so'i thigs kyi gtso bo dang gnyis su med par gyur nas thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa'i byang chub sems
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i tshul dus sangs rgyas spyad la sogs pa'i lha @150b mo bzhis so so'i rigs kyi bdag po la bskul ma thag so so'i thigs kyi gtso bo dang gnyis su med par gyur nas thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa'i byang chub sems
translated: this means that the four goddesses, Buddha Locana, and so on, having been exhorted by the lords of their respective families, immediately become nondual with the principal figures of their respective families and generate the bodhicitta of the play of method and wisdom.

original: las sems can 'dul ba'i thabs sna tshogs pa dang // de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa sna tshogs su sbrul zhing phyogs bcur spros nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dgyes par byas pa dang sems can gyi don thams cad rdzogs par byas nas slar so so'i thugs kar tha mi dad par bsam mo //üîΩde nas yang so so'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa byas pas byang chub kyi sems kyi 'od 'phros pas so so'i rigs kyi lha rnams la phog ma thag tu 'od de nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur nas slar gong ma bzhin du gtso bo'i thugs kar
analyzed: las sems can 'dul ba'i thabs sna tshogs pa dang // de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa sna tshogs su sbrul zhing phyogs bcur spros nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dgyes par byas pa dang sems can gyi don thams cad rdzogs par byas nas slar so so'i thugs kar tha mi dad par bsam mo // de nas yang so so'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa byas pas byang chub kyi sems kyi 'od 'phros pas so so'i rigs kyi lha rnams la phog ma thag tu 'od de nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur nas slar gong ma bzhin du gtso bo'i thugs kar
translated: The activities are emanations of various methods for training sentient beings and various offerings to the tathagatas. After emanating to the ten directions and delighting the tathagatas and completing all the purposes of sentient beings, they dissolve indivisibly into the individual hearts.üîΩThen, again, through the display of method and prajna, the light of bodhicitta shines and immediately strikes the deities of the individual families, whereby they become the nature of that light.

original: thim mo // de nas yang thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa mdzad pas gtso bo nyid bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems su gyur nas yum gyi bha ga la thim nas gnyis su med par gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: thim mo // de nas yang thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa mdzad pas gtso bo nyid bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems su gyur nas yum gyi bha ga la thim nas gnyis su med par gyur par bsam mo //
translated: Again, as before, they dissolve into the heart of the principal. Then, again, through the display of method and prajna, the principal himself becomes the nature of great bliss, bodhicitta, and dissolves into the bhaga of the mother, becoming nondual.

original: de nas rigs bzhi'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sems dpa' sems ma dang / khro bo dang khro mo rnams yum bzhi la thim pa'i yum bzhis dbus kyi gtso bo la so so'i rigs kyi bdag po'i sgo nas bstod cing bskul bas de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa byes ces pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rigs bzhi'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sems dpa' sems ma dang / khro bo dang khro mo rnams yum bzhi la thim pa'i yum bzhis dbus kyi gtso bo la so so'i rigs kyi bdag po'i sgo nas bstod cing bskul bas de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa byes ces pa'o //
translated: Then, the Tathagatas of the four clans, the male and female Bodhisattvas, and the male and female wrathful deities dissolve into the four mothers. The four mothers praise the principal deity in the center by means of their respective clan lords, and exhort him. This is the praise of the Tathagata.

original: mi bskyod ye shes rdo rje che //
analyzed: mi bskyod ye shes rdo rje che //
translated: Ak~obhya is the great wisdom vajra.

original: zhes pa'i tshig su bcad pa gcig gis ni lha mo m'a ma k'i sa chog kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig su bcad pa gcig gis ni lha mo m'a ma k'i sa chog kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: With this one verse, he praises the goddess Mamaki by means of the wisdom of the realm of space.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgyar gnas pa de la nyon mongs pa dang drag byed la sogs pa'i bdud rnams kyis bskyod cing g-yo bar mi nus bas mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgyar gnas pa de la nyon mongs pa dang drag byed la sogs pa'i bdud rnams kyis bskyod cing g-yo bar mi nus bas mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat, abiding in the seal of the Bodhisattva Vajra Ak~obhya, is called Ak~obhya because the Maras of affliction, of the aggregates, etc., are not able to move or shake him.

original: ye shes ni chos kyi skur ston pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni chos kyi skur ston pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the teaching of the Dharma body.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi chos yis kyi sku de yang nam mkha' ltar chad pa ma yin zhing kun rdzob tu sems can gyi don du sna tshogs su 'byung bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi chos yis kyi sku de yang nam mkha' ltar chad pa ma yin zhing kun rdzob tu sems can gyi don du sna tshogs su 'byung bas so //
translated: That body of the Dharma of the Vajra Realm is not cut off like space, and in the relative [truth] it arises in various ways for the sake of sentient beings.

original: blo chen po ni de ltar bur snang ba rnams sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu dgos pa'i thabs dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: blo chen po ni de ltar bur snang ba rnams sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu dgos pa'i thabs dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: The great mind is the appearance of those [bodies] as the means for the purpose of all sentient beings attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: rdo rje gsum mchog ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mchog ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The three supreme vajras are the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum ni de nyid las rigs gsum du ston pa'o //üîΩde lta bu'i de 'jig rten pa rnams kyis rtogs @151a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum ni de nyid las rigs gsum du ston pa'o // de lta bu'i de 'jig rten pa rnams kyis rtogs @151a * //
translated: The three mandalas are the teaching of the three families from that [nature].

original: shing spyod pa'i yul ma yin pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bstan du mi rung bas gsang ba'i dbyings su //
analyzed: shing spyod pa'i yul ma yin pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bstan du mi rung bas gsang ba'i dbyings su //
translated: Such [a nature] is not an object of realization and practice for worldly people, and it is unsuitable to be taught to ≈õrƒÅvakas and others, so it is the secret realm.

original: de lta bu de nyid la lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal na bsod nams thob par 'gyur bas phyi rabs kyi rnal 'byor pas tshul 'di bzhin du bstod cing phyag 'tshal bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu de nyid la lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal na bsod nams thob par 'gyur bas phyi rabs kyi rnal 'byor pas tshul 'di bzhin du bstod cing phyag 'tshal bar ston pa'o //
translated: If one bows down to such a one with body, speech, and mind, one will obtain merit.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dga' chen po //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dga' chen po //
translated: The great joy of Vairocana

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni lha mo sangs rgyas spyan gyis rang gi gtso bo la me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod cing bskul ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni lha mo sangs rgyas spyan gyis rang gi gtso bo la me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod cing bskul ba'o //
translated: and so forth. The goddess BuddhalocanƒÅ praises her chief with the mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad ni sku las 'od sna tshogs 'phros shing 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mun pa sel shing snang bar mdzad pa dang / gdul bya'i sems can gyi mos pa'i sgo nas sku sna tshogs su sprul zhing snang bar mdzad nas de rnams kyi gti mug gi mun pa bsal nas ye shes kyi snang bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad ni sku las 'od sna tshogs 'phros shing 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mun pa sel shing snang bar mdzad pa dang / gdul bya'i sems can gyi mos pa'i sgo nas sku sna tshogs su sprul zhing snang bar mdzad nas de rnams kyi gti mug gi mun pa bsal nas ye shes kyi snang bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: Therein, Vairocana is the one who emanates various lights from his body, dispels the darkness of the world-realms, and illuminates them. Having emanated and appeared in various bodies according to the inclinations of the sentient beings to be tamed, he dispels the darkness of their ignorance and generates the light of pristine awareness.

original: yang na thabs dang shes rab kyi sgo nas sems can rnams la bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na thabs dang shes rab kyi sgo nas sems can rnams la bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is because he illuminates sentient beings with the nature of great bliss by means of method and wisdom.

original: dga' chen po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa nyan thos lta bur rim gyis spong ba ma yin te ye nas mi mnga' ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' chen po ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa nyan thos lta bur rim gyis spong ba ma yin te ye nas mi mnga' ba'i don to //
translated: Great joy is not the gradual abandonment of afflictions such as desire like the ≈õrƒÅvakas; it means that he is primordially free of them.

original: de'i phyir na rdo rje zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rdo rje zhi ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the vajra peace.

original: dgyes pa che zhing ni de lta bu'i don gyis rtag tu mi mthun pa mi mnga' ba dang / lha mo bzhi dang gnyis su med pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa rtag tu mdzad cing bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgyes pa che zhing ni de lta bu'i don gyis rtag tu mi mthun pa mi mnga' ba dang / lha mo bzhi dang gnyis su med pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa rtag tu mdzad cing bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Greatly delighted, he is always free of disharmony by virtue of that meaning, and he always performs the play of method and wisdom, which is nondual with the four goddesses, and he abides in the nature of the experience of great bliss.

original: de lta bu'i tshul du lhun gyis grub pas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul du lhun gyis grub pas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o /
translated: In that way, he is naturally luminous by virtue of his spontaneous presence.

original: mchog ni khams gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: mchog ni khams gsum gyi'o //
translated: Supreme means of the three realms.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin ni rdo rje'o //
translated: The nature of such a self-nature is the vajra.

original: de nyid gzhan la bstan zhing thob par mdzad pas rdo rje ston pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan la bstan zhing thob par mdzad pas rdo rje ston pa'o //
translated: He is the Vajra Teacher because he teaches that to others and causes them to attain it.

original: de lta bu la phyag 'tshal bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu la phyag 'tshal bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is to be saluted in that way.

original: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
analyzed: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
translated: The Jewel King, very profound,

original: ces pa la sogs pas ni mnyam pa nyid kyi sgo nas rin po che'i rigs la lha mo ratna dha ras bstod pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pas ni mnyam pa nyid kyi sgo nas rin po che'i rigs la lha mo ratna dha ras bstod pa'o //
translated: and so forth. Ratnadhatvi≈õodhani praises the Jewel Family from the point of view of equality.

original: de la rin chen rgyal po bcom ldan 'das ma de nyid rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag rgyar gnas shing sems can thams cad kyi re ba bskang ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes las grub pa'i yidüîΩbzhin @151b gyi rin po che phyag tu bsnams pa'am /
analyzed: de la rin chen rgyal po bcom ldan 'das ma de nyid rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag rgyar gnas shing sems can thams cad kyi re ba bskang ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes las grub pa'i yid bzhin @151b gyi rin po che phyag tu bsnams pa'am /
translated: There, the Jewel King, the Blessed Lady herself, dwelling in the seal of Ratnasa·πÉbhava, holds in her hand the wish-granting jewel, which is the nature of the qualities of all the Buddhas, in order to fulfill the hopes of all sentient beings, and which is accomplished from the gnosis of equality.

original: yang na bdag nyid rin po che de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid rin po che de lta bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, she is herself the nature of that jewel.

original: bdud bzhi las rgyal zhing khams gsum gyi dri mas ma gos pa'i phyir rgyal po'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi las rgyal zhing khams gsum gyi dri mas ma gos pa'i phyir rgyal po'o //
translated: She is a king because she is victorious over the four demons and is unstained by the impurities of the three realms.

original: de nyid kyi tshul mthar thug pa med pas shin tu zab pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshul mthar thug pa med pas shin tu zab pa'o //
translated: Since the way of that is not ultimate, it is very profound.

original: de lta bu'i phyag rgya ston cing sems can gyi don sna tshogs mdzad kyang de nyid la mi chags pas dri med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyag rgya ston cing sems can gyi don sna tshogs mdzad kyang de nyid la mi chags pas dri med pa'o //
translated: Even though it displays such a seal and performs various benefits for sentient beings, it is stainless because it is not attached to that.

original: de lta bu yin yang don dam par dmigs pa med pa'i tshul yin pas nam mkha' rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de lta bu yin yang don dam par dmigs pa med pa'i tshul yin pas nam mkha' rdo rje'o //
translated: Even though it is like that, it is the way of not observing the ultimate, so it is the vajra of space.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rang bzhin dgag pas gos pa med //
analyzed: rang bzhin dgag pas gos pa med //
translated: it is unstained by the negation of intrinsic nature.

original: ces smos so //
analyzed: ces smos so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: de lta bu de'i gsung yang gzhan du mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta bu de'i gsung yang gzhan du mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Even though it is like that, its speech is not otherwise,

original: dag pa'i gsung la phyag 'tshal lo /
analyzed: dag pa'i gsung la phyag 'tshal lo /
translated: so it is the pure speech.

original: zhes bya'o // rgyal chen rdo rje snang mtha' yas //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rgyal chen rdo rje snang mtha' yas //
translated: Homage to the great king, the vajra AmitƒÅbha.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas lha mo panda ra ba sis padma rigs la bstod pa'o /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas lha mo panda ra ba sis padma rigs la bstod pa'o /
translated: And so forth. The goddess PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´ praises the lotus family from the perspective of the individually discerning pristine consciousness.

original: sku las 'od zer 'phros pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku las 'od zer 'phros pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the light rays emanating from the body are inconceivable.

original: kun rdzob tu phyag rgyar bstan zhing 'dod chags dang du len cing spyod pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi don mdzad kyang de'i nyes pa rnams kyis mi gos pas pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu phyag rgyar bstan zhing 'dod chags dang du len cing spyod pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi don mdzad kyang de'i nyes pa rnams kyis mi gos pas pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: He is the Perfection because he acts for the sake of sentient beings by means of the method of taking desire into his own experience, while being revealed as a seal in the conventional sense, and because he is not sullied by their faults.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: And for that very reason,

original: rnam par mi rtog rdo rje mkha' //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog rdo rje mkha' //
translated: he is the vajra space of nonconceptuality.

original: zhes pa'o // de lta bu de dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi rang bzhin yin pas rdo rje gsung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de lta bu de dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi rang bzhin yin pas rdo rje gsung ngo //
translated: That suchness is the vajra speech because it is the nature of the speech of the buddhas of the three times.

original: rdo rje don grub yang dag shes //
analyzed: rdo rje don grub yang dag shes //
translated: He is the vajra Amoghasiddhi, the perfect knowledge.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni lha mo ta ras bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni lha mo ta ras bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: And so forth. Here, the goddess Tara praises with the knowledge of purposeful activity.

original: de la rdo rje don grub ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi phrin las kyi rang bzhin gyi phyag rgyar gnas nas sems can gyi don kun grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rdo rje don grub ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi phrin las kyi rang bzhin gyi phyag rgyar gnas nas sems can gyi don kun grub par byed pa'o //
translated: There, the vajra Amoghasiddhi is the seal that is the nature of the activity of all buddhas, abiding in the accomplishment of all the aims of sentient beings.

original: de yang 'khrul pa dang mu cor med pa yin zhing mos pa dang mthun pa'i sgo nas don mdzad pas yang dag go //
analyzed: de yang 'khrul pa dang mu cor med pa yin zhing mos pa dang mthun pa'i sgo nas don mdzad pas yang dag go //
translated: Moreover, it is correct because it is not deluded or incoherent, and it performs its function in accordance with the inclinations of those to be trained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: For that very reason,

original: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par mdzad //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par mdzad //
translated: it fulfills all wishes.

original: ces bya'o // de yang 'khor ba pa bzhin du las kyis skyes pa ma yin zhing chos kyi sku las snang par gyur pas rang bzhin dag pa nyid las byung zhes bya //
analyzed: ces bya'o // de yang 'khor ba pa bzhin du las kyis skyes pa ma yin zhing chos kyi sku las snang par gyur pas rang bzhin dag pa nyid las byung zhes bya //
translated: Moreover, it is not born from karma like transmigrators are, and it appears from the dharmakƒÅya, so it is said to ‚Äúarise from natural purity.‚Äù

original: de dag thams cad rdo rje sems dpa' nyid yin pas rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i don te //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rdo rje sems dpa' nyid yin pas rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i don te //
translated: Since all of those are Vajrasattva himself, the meaning of ‚Äúhomage to Vajrasattva‚Äù is that.

original: de ltar bstod tshig zhi ba yis //
analyzed: de ltar bstod tshig zhi ba yis //
translated: Thus, with these peaceful verses of praise,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bstod byas shing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bstod byas shing //
translated: all buddhas are praised,

original: rdo rje longs spyod kyis bskul na //
analyzed: rdo rje longs spyod kyis bskul na //
translated: and when urged by Vajra-Bhoga,

original: de yang sangs rgyas 'dra bar @152a * //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas 'dra bar @152a * //
translated: they are like buddhas.

original: 'gyur // zhes pa ni de ltar lha mo rnams kyis rigs lnga'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das zhe sdang rdo rje la bstod cing bskul ba'i tshigs bcad rnams kyi phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: 'gyur // zhes pa ni de ltar lha mo rnams kyis rigs lnga'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das zhe sdang rdo rje la bstod cing bskul ba'i tshigs bcad rnams kyi phan yon bstan te /
translated: The phrase will be attained indicates the benefits of the verses of praise and exhortation to the Bhagavat, the vajra of hatred, by the goddesses in terms of the five families.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: phyi rabs kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang lha mo rnams kyis ji ltar bstod cing bskul ba bzhin du dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la thabs dang shes rab kyi sgo nas bstod cing bskul na sangs rgyas rnams kyang mnyes shing
analyzed: phyi rabs kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang lha mo rnams kyis ji ltar bstod cing bskul ba bzhin du dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la thabs dang shes rab kyi sgo nas bstod cing bskul na sangs rgyas rnams kyang mnyes shing
translated: If the yogins of future generations praise and exhort the Tathagatas, such as glorious Vajrasattva, in terms of method and wisdom, just as the goddesses praise and exhort, then the Buddhas will be pleased and

original: dgyes par gyur nas de la dngos grub stsol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgyes par gyur nas de la dngos grub stsol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: will be delighted, and will grant spiritual powers to them.

original: yang na dam tshig bsrung ba'i mchog de nyid yin pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par gyur pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na dam tshig bsrung ba'i mchog de nyid yin pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par gyur pa'i don to //
translated: Alternatively, since that is the supreme protection of the commitments, it has the meaning of the accumulations of merit and wisdom will be perfected.

original: lha mos de bzhin gshegs bstod pa //
analyzed: lha mos de bzhin gshegs bstod pa //
translated: The goddesses praise the Tathagatas

original: rdo rje blo yis gzigs nas ni //
analyzed: rdo rje blo yis gzigs nas ni //
translated: with vajra intelligence.

original: sku gsung thugs la bsdus nas kyang //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs la bsdus nas kyang //
translated: And also gathering into body, speech, and mind,

original: sna tshogs rjes su chags par mdzad //
analyzed: sna tshogs rjes su chags par mdzad //
translated: he acts with passion for the various goddesses.

original: ces bya ba ni de ltar lha mo rnams kyis bstod cing bskul bas zhe sdang rdo rjes dgongs pa'i tshul du 'dzum pa mdzad nas nyid kyi sku gsung thugs dang de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs gnyis su med par mdzad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de ltar lha mo rnams kyis bstod cing bskul bas zhe sdang rdo rjes dgongs pa'i tshul du 'dzum pa mdzad nas nyid kyi sku gsung thugs dang de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs gnyis su med par mdzad do //
translated: Thus, by the praise and urging of the goddesses, Hatred Vajra smiles in the manner of intention, and his body, speech, and mind and theirs become nondual.

original: de la skabs 'dir sku ni rdo rje dang padma'o //
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir sku ni rdo rje dang padma'o //
translated: Here, body is the vajra and lotus.

original: gsung ni zhal sprod pa'o //
analyzed: gsung ni zhal sprod pa'o //
translated: Speech is the facing of the faces.

original: thugs ni snying ga sprad cing dam por 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: thugs ni snying ga sprad cing dam por 'khyud pa'o //
translated: Mind is the embrace of the hearts and the tight embrace.

original: sna tshogs rjes su chags par mdzad pa ni de ltar gyur nas ka ma la sh'i gham las 'byung ba'i tshul du so so chags par mdzad cing bde ba chen po nyams su blangs shing sems can gyi don mdzad nas /
analyzed: sna tshogs rjes su chags par mdzad pa ni de ltar gyur nas ka ma la sh'i gham las 'byung ba'i tshul du so so chags par mdzad cing bde ba chen po nyams su blangs shing sems can gyi don mdzad nas /
translated: Acting with passion for the various goddesses means that having become that way, he acts with passion for each one in the manner of arising from the space of the camel, experiences great bliss, and acts for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: yang thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa byas nas byang chub kyi sems phab ma thag tu lha mo rnams 'od kyi tshul du gyur nas nyid kyi sku gsung thugs la thim zhing gnyis su med par gyur par bsgom par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa byas nas byang chub kyi sems phab ma thag tu lha mo rnams 'od kyi tshul du gyur nas nyid kyi sku gsung thugs la thim zhing gnyis su med par gyur par bsgom par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Again, having performed the play of means and wisdom, as soon as the bodhicitta descends, the goddesses become in the manner of light and dissolve into one‚Äôs body, speech, and mind, and one should meditate on becoming nondual.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad mthong ba ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad mthong ba ni //
translated: Seeing all ma·πá·∏çalas

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
translated: means the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom pa'am /
translated: This refers to the ma·πá·∏çala taught above, which is meditated on with samƒÅdhi,

original: gzugs brnyan du bkod pa rnams de ltar nyid kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du bsdu bar byas nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan du bkod pa rnams de ltar nyid kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du bsdu bar byas nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: or the ma·πá·∏çala that is arranged in a picture. Having gathered them in that way into the nature of one‚Äôs body, speech, and mind, that is the meaning.

original: cho ga ni gong du bsdus pa'i tshul bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: cho ga ni gong du bsdus pa'i tshul bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The rite is the method of gathering taught above.

original: de ltar bsdus nas kyang ci byed ce na /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus nas kyang ci byed ce na /
translated: Having gathered in that way, what should one do?

original: bzlas pa dag kyang bsdu bar bya //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: bzlas pa dag kyang bsdu bar bya //üîΩzhes smos so //
translated: One should also gather the recitations.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor thams cad bsdus nas thugs ka na gnas pa'i h'um las 'od zer 'phros shing @152b bar snang khyab par gnas pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la phog pas de rnams kyang 'od kyi tshul du gyur nas slar bdag la thim par bsam mo //üîΩde nas yang 'od zer 'phros pas bdag phyag rgyar gnas pa'i sku la phog pas 'od du gyur nas thugs ka na gnas pa'i ye shes sems dpa' la thim mo //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor thams cad bsdus nas thugs ka na gnas pa'i h'um las 'od zer 'phros shing @152b bar snang khyab par gnas pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la phog pas de rnams kyang 'od kyi tshul du gyur nas slar bdag la thim par bsam mo // de nas yang 'od zer 'phros pas bdag phyag rgyar gnas pa'i sku la phog pas 'od du gyur nas thugs ka na gnas pa'i ye shes sems dpa' la thim mo //
translated: In this way, having gathered all the mandalas, light rays radiate from the h≈´·πÉ at the heart and touch the buddhas dwelling in the space, which causes them to also become light. Imagine that they dissolve back into oneself.üîΩAgain, light rays radiate and touch the form of oneself abiding as the pledge being, which causes it to become light and dissolve into the gnosis being abiding at the heart.

original: de nas yang h'um las 'od zer 'phros pas ye shes sems dpa' la phog pas de yang 'od kyi tshul du h'um la thim mo //
analyzed: de nas yang h'um las 'od zer 'phros pas ye shes sems dpa' la phog pas de yang 'od kyi tshul du h'um la thim mo //
translated: Again, light rays radiate from the h≈´·πÉ and touch the gnosis being, which causes it to also become light and dissolve into the h≈´·πÉ.

original: de nas yang 'od 'phros pas h'um yang 'od du gyur to //
analyzed: de nas yang 'od 'phros pas h'um yang 'od du gyur to //
translated: Again, light radiates and the h≈´·πÉ also becomes light.

original: 'od kyang phyogs bcur 'phros pas nam mkha' dang gnyis su med par gyur nas chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od kyang phyogs bcur 'phros pas nam mkha' dang gnyis su med par gyur nas chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du gnas par bya'o //
translated: The light also radiates into the ten directions, becoming inseparable from space, abiding in the nature of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: de ltar gnas pa yang ci nus su gnas nas ldang zhing 'gro bar 'dod na spyi bo dang lce steng dang snying gar sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon yi ge gsum dmigs nas sngags gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la ci bde bar gnas par bya ba'i don noüîΩ// ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa na //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa yang ci nus su gnas nas ldang zhing 'gro bar 'dod na spyi bo dang lce steng dang snying gar sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon yi ge gsum dmigs nas sngags gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la ci bde bar gnas par bya ba'i don no // ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa na //
translated: Thus, having remained in that way as long as possible, if one wishes to rise and go, one should visualize the three seed syllables of body, speech, and mind at the head, on the tongue, and at the heart, and bless them with the three mantras. The meaning is that one should remain as long as is comfortable.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnal 'byor pas dus yun ring por sgom zhing sgrub pa'i tshe lus nyam chung bar gyur na thabs 'dis gzi byin bskyed cing brtan par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnal 'byor pas dus yun ring por sgom zhing sgrub pa'i tshe lus nyam chung bar gyur na thabs 'dis gzi byin bskyed cing brtan par bya ba bstan to //
translated: With regard to the line that goes in the visualization of meditative concentration, and so on, when a practitioner is meditating and practicing for a long time, if the body becomes weak, this method teaches how to generate and stabilize brilliance.

original: de la ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one do that?

original: bdag gi spyi bo'i steng bar snang la mtho gong gi tshad tsam du yi ge aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la de'i steng du dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yi ge aom bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi spyi bo'i steng bar snang la mtho gong gi tshad tsam du yi ge aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la de'i steng du dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yi ge aom bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize an ƒÅ·∏• syllable in the space above the crown of one's head, about the height of a human head. From that arises a moon ma·πá·∏çala. On top of that one should visualize an o·πÉ syllable, the nature of the wisdom of all tathƒÅgatas of the three times.

original: de las 'od zer 'phros pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bcud rnams bkug nas aom de nyid la thim par bsam mo //
analyzed: de las 'od zer 'phros pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bcud rnams bkug nas aom de nyid la thim par bsam mo //
translated: Light rays emanate from that, drawing in the vital essences of the world systems of the ten directions, which dissolve into that o·πÉ.

original: de nas yang aom de bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i bcud rnams 'od kyi tshul du zla ba'i steng du 'thigs par bsam mo //
analyzed: de nas yang aom de bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i bcud rnams 'od kyi tshul du zla ba'i steng du 'thigs par bsam mo //
translated: Then, again, think that the vital essences that exist in the nature of nectar on the moon are dripping in the form of light rays.

original: de dang zla ba'i bdud rtsi gnyis gcig tu byung nas zla ba las bdag gi spyi bor thigs pa 'od zer gyi tshul du thim zhing lus kun du khyab par bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang zla ba'i bdud rtsi gnyis gcig tu byung nas zla ba las bdag gi spyi bor thigs pa 'od zer gyi tshul du thim zhing lus kun du khyab par bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: The nectar and the moon become one, and from the moon, drops in the form of light rays fall on one‚Äôs crown, and one meditates on them pervading the whole body.

original: bdud rtsi rnams ni 'byung bar bsam //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi rnams ni 'byung bar bsam // zhes smos so //
translated: Think that the nectars are flowing.

original: rdo rje sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: rdo rje sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
translated: By this vajra yoga,

original: skad cig du yang mdangs ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig du yang mdangs ldan 'gyur //
translated: in an instant one will have radiance.

original: lus dang ngag sems bde bar gnas //üîΩthe tshom @153a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems bde bar gnas // the tshom @153a * //
translated: One‚Äôs body, speech, and mind will be blissful,

original: med par gyur pa yin //
analyzed: med par gyur pa yin //
translated: and one will be free of doubt.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan te ye shes kyi sbyor ba nge bstan pa bzhin du ma nor bar bsgoms na gza' byin skye zhing bstan par nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan te ye shes kyi sbyor ba nge bstan pa bzhin du ma nor bar bsgoms na gza' byin skye zhing bstan par nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, the benefits of such meditation are taught. If one meditates without error in accordance with the teaching of the yoga of gnosis, one will certainly be born in the lineage of the buddhas and will be taught.

original: bkres skom la sogs sdug bsngal la //
analyzed: bkres skom la sogs sdug bsngal la //
translated: Hunger, thirst, and so on,

original: sbyor ba 'di ni rnam par bsam //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di ni rnam par bsam //
translated: are to be thought of as this yoga.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor pa bkres skom la sogs pa byung zhing yo byad la sogs pa med na ting nge 'dzin spong zhing tshol du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor pa bkres skom la sogs pa byung zhing yo byad la sogs pa med na ting nge 'dzin spong zhing tshol du mi 'gro ste /
translated: If a yogin is hungry, thirsty, and so on, and lacks the requisites and so on, he should not abandon samƒÅdhi and go in search of them.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho ga bya zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho ga bya zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that he should perform the rite that will be explained below.

original: de byas na bkres ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsal thams cad med par 'gyur bar nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de byas na bkres ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsal thams cad med par 'gyur bar nges pa'i phyir //
translated: If he does that, all the sufferings of hunger and so on will certainly be eliminated.

original: mi gtsang rdo rje tshig bzhin te //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: mi gtsang rdo rje tshig bzhin te // zhes smos so //
translated: The vajra of impurity is just like that.

original: mi gtsang rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen po'o //
translated: The vajra of impurity is MahƒÅvairocana.

original: de'i gsung gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gsung gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: His speech is unchanging.

original: de yang ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How is that to be done?

original: bdag lha gang bsgom yang rung ste bkres pa la sogs pa byung na de ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgyar bsgoms la /üîΩkha'i yar rkan la he las 'dod 'jo'i ba kha dog dkar mo gcig bsam //
analyzed: bdag lha gang bsgom yang rung ste bkres pa la sogs pa byung na de ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgyar bsgoms la / kha'i yar rkan la he las 'dod 'jo'i ba kha dog dkar mo gcig bsam //
translated: Whatever deity one meditates on, if hunger and so forth arise, then immediately one should meditate on the seal of the Bhagavat Vairocana.üîΩIn the upper palate of the mouth one should imagine a white wish-fulfilling cow arising from he.üîΩOn the tongue one should visualize a white o·πÉ surrounded by a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: lce'i steng du aom dkar po gcig dmigs la de'i mtha' yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po ches bskor bar bsgoms pa'i rnam par snang mdzad gzugs chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lce'i steng du aom dkar po gcig dmigs la de'i mtha' yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po ches bskor bar bsgoms pa'i rnam par snang mdzad gzugs chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: One should meditate on the great form of Vairocana, and so forth.

original: sdug bsngal kun sel zhi ba ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun sel zhi ba ni //
translated: The pacification that removes all suffering

original: ye shes rdo rjes byin brlabs te /
analyzed: ye shes rdo rjes byin brlabs te /
translated: is blessed by the vajra of wisdom.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms nas ye shes las gyur pa'i ba dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che las yid la 'dod pa'i zas la sogs ba rnams lce'i steng du byung zhing lus kun du thim par bsam pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad de'i byin rlabs kyis med par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms nas ye shes las gyur pa'i ba dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che las yid la 'dod pa'i zas la sogs ba rnams lce'i steng du byung zhing lus kun du thim par bsam pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad de'i byin rlabs kyis med par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: And all suffering is eliminated by the blessing of that.

original: gang zhig 'di ni sgom byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di ni sgom byed pa //
translated: He who meditates on this

original: byang chub sems dpa' grags chen 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grags chen 'gyur //
translated: becomes a famous bodhisattva.

original: zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i sgrub thabs de yan chad du bshang pa bzhin bsgoms shing bsgrubs pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i sgrub thabs de yan chad du bshang pa bzhin bsgoms shing bsgrubs pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: This teaches the benefit of meditating on and accomplishing the method of great bliss up to this point.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: tshe 'di nyid la rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur bas de ma thob pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpa'i grangs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur bas de ma thob pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpa'i grangs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one becomes Vajrasattva in this very life, one is counted as a bodhisattva until one attains that.

original: de yang sgom zhing sgrub pa'i dus @153b thams cad du byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis dang 'bral du mi rung pas //
analyzed: de yang sgom zhing sgrub pa'i dus @153b thams cad du byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis dang 'bral du mi rung pas //
translated: Moreover, since it is not suitable to be separated from the two types of bodhicitta at all times during meditation and practice,üîΩit is taught:

original: byang chub sems dang sbyor ldan na //
analyzed: byang chub sems dang sbyor ldan na //
translated: If one is endowed with bodhicitta,

original: sku sogs dngos grub thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bstan to //
analyzed: sku sogs dngos grub thob par 'gyur // zhes bstan to //
translated: one will attain the siddhis of the kƒÅyas, and so on.

original: dad pa med dang theg dman zhugs //
analyzed: dad pa med dang theg dman zhugs //
translated: The absence of faith, the lower vehicles,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni gsang sngags ma h'a yo ga'i snying po rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po gsang ba 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni gsang sngags ma h'a yo ga'i snying po rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po gsang ba 'dus pa yin la /
translated: and so on, teach that the GuhyasamƒÅja is the great king of tantras, the essence of the secret mantra MahƒÅyoga.

original: de yang de'i don gyi snying po bsdus pa 'di yin pas kun gyi thun mong ma yin pas shin tu yang gsang bar bya zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de yang de'i don gyi snying po bsdus pa 'di yin pas kun gyi thun mong ma yin pas shin tu yang gsang bar bya zhes bstan to //
translated: Moreover, since this is the concise essence of its meaning, it is taught that it should be kept extremely secret because it is not common to all.

original: de la dad pa med pa ni yid mi ches pa dang tshul bzhin du mi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa med pa ni yid mi ches pa dang tshul bzhin du mi sgrub pa'o //
translated: Absence of faith‚Äù means not believing and not practicing properly.

original: theg dman zhugs pa ni yo ga man chad dang du len cing spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: theg dman zhugs pa ni yo ga man chad dang du len cing spyod pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúEngaging in the lower vehicles‚Äù means accepting and engaging in Yoga and below.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang ni 'dod chags shin tu che ba dang zhe sdang shin tu che ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang ni 'dod chags shin tu che ba dang zhe sdang shin tu che ba rnams so //
translated: Passion and hatred are those of very great passion and very great hatred.

original: dbang po rtul pa ni de lta bu'i skyon med kyang shes rab chung ba'i dbang gis bstan kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rtul pa ni de lta bu'i skyon med kyang shes rab chung ba'i dbang gis bstan kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those of dull faculties, even though they are free from those faults, are not to be taught because they would become confused even though taught, due to the weakness of their wisdom.

original: slob dang bu la sbyin mi bya //
analyzed: slob dang bu la sbyin mi bya //
translated: One should not give it to a disciple or a son.

original: zhes pa ni dad pa med pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa'i skyes bu bdag gi bu yang rung chos 'di ma rtogs pa'i sgo nas slob bur gyur cing zhes pa la sogs kyang bstan par mi bya zhes pa'i don to //üîΩgang phyir sgrub pa 'di brtsams pa //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dad pa med pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod pa'i skyes bu bdag gi bu yang rung chos 'di ma rtogs pa'i sgo nas slob bur gyur cing zhes pa la sogs kyang bstan par mi bya zhes pa'i don to // gang phyir sgrub pa 'di brtsams pa //
translated: The meaning of this is that one should not teach this tantra to a disciple who has not understood it, even if he is one's own son, because he has faults such as lack of faith.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni phyi rabs kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis yid mi ches shing skur ba 'debs par dgongs nas rgyud kyi khungs la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni phyi rabs kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis yid mi ches shing skur ba 'debs par dgongs nas rgyud kyi khungs la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The meaning of because this practice was undertaken and so forth is that, thinking that future yogis would not believe it and would slander it, he taught the source of the tantra and so forth.

original: de la / gang phyir sgrub pa 'di brtsams pa //
analyzed: de la / gang phyir sgrub pa 'di brtsams pa //
translated: In this regard, because this practice was undertaken and so forth is said.

original: zhes pa ni slob dpon gyis sgrub pa'i thabs 'di brtsam pa 'di don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob dpon gyis sgrub pa'i thabs 'di brtsam pa 'di don med pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not meaningless, since the master composed this means of achievement.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' sgrub phyir zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' sgrub phyir zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: It is connected with the words ‚Äúin order to accomplish Vajrasattva.‚ÄùüîΩIn order to show that this is not rash,

original: de la bab col ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩrgyud don mngon par rtogs nas ni //
analyzed: de la bab col ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir // rgyud don mngon par rtogs nas ni //
translated: he says,

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: ‚Äúhaving realized the meaning of the tantra.‚Äù

original: de yang rgyud kyi rgyal po gsang ba 'dus pa bdag gi slob dpon gyis bstan pa dang / rang gi shes rab kyis ma nor bar shes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang rgyud kyi rgyal po gsang ba 'dus pa bdag gi slob dpon gyis bstan pa dang / rang gi shes rab kyis ma nor bar shes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the master has taught the King of Tantras, the Guhyasamaja, and has understood its meaning without error through his own wisdom.

original: rdo rje bzhad pa'i slob dpon gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhad pa'i slob dpon gyis //
translated: The master Vajrahasavajra

original: zhes pa ni nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: shows his own name.

original: nyid la nyid slob dpon zhes gsungs pa ni yul thams cad du slob dpon du grags pa dang mkhas par zhal gyis 'ches ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid la nyid slob dpon zhes gsungs pa ni yul thams cad du slob dpon du grags pa dang mkhas par zhal gyis 'ches ba'i don to //
translated: He says ‚Äúmaster of himself‚Äù in the sense of being renowned as a master in all countries and of being a self-proclaimed scholar.üîΩWhy did the master compose this?

original: slob dpon gyis ci'i phyir mdzad ce na /üîΩsems can yi @154a * //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ci'i phyir mdzad ce na / sems can yi @154a * //
translated: He says,

original: shes bskyed phyir ro //üîΩzhes smos so //
analyzed: shes bskyed phyir ro //üîΩzhes smos so //
translated: ‚Äúin order to generate the wisdom of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: de yang gong du rdo rje sems dpa' sgrub phyir zhes bstan na 'dir de skad ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gong du rdo rje sems dpa' sgrub phyir zhes bstan na 'dir de skad ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Now, if it was taught above that one should practice for the sake of accomplishing Vajrasattva, why is it taught here in this way?

original: rdo rje sems dpa' tshe 'di nyid la ma grub na yang 'di shes shing thos par gyur na rgyud gsang ba 'dus pa shes bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' tshe 'di nyid la ma grub na yang 'di shes shing thos par gyur na rgyud gsang ba 'dus pa shes bar 'gyur la /
translated: Even if one does not accomplish Vajrasattva in this very lifetime, if one comes to know and hear this, one will come to know the Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: de shes pas gsang sngags rnams la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang tha snyad thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de shes pas gsang sngags rnams la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang tha snyad thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By knowing that, one will become skilled in the secret mantras and become skilled in all conventions.

original: dpal bde ba chen po'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so //
analyzed: dpal bde ba chen po'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so //
translated: The sadhana of glorious great bliss is complete.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is said.

original: dpal bde ba chen po'i sgo nas bde ba chen po dpal rdo rje sems dpa' mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i thabs sam de nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i thabs so //
analyzed: dpal bde ba chen po'i sgo nas bde ba chen po dpal rdo rje sems dpa' mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i thabs sam de nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i thabs so //
translated: By means of the glorious great bliss, it is the method for the actualization of glorious Vajrasattva, great bliss, or the method for becoming of the nature of that.

original: rdzogs pa ni nyid kyi dgongs pa ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni nyid kyi dgongs pa ma lus pa'o //
translated: Complete is the complete intention of the teacher.

original: sgrub thabs rnam par bshad pa 'di /
analyzed: sgrub thabs rnam par bshad pa 'di /
translated: This explanation of the sadhana

original: bdag gis byas ba'i dge ba yis //
analyzed: bdag gis byas ba'i dge ba yis //
translated: by the virtue I have created

original: 'gro ba rnams kyis 'di nyid kyi //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyis 'di nyid kyi //
translated: may all beings

original: don ni rnam par rtogs bar shog //
analyzed: don ni rnam par rtogs bar shog //
translated: The meaning is to be realized.

original: dpal bde ba chen po'i 'grel pa slob dpon chen po bi m'a la garbhas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: dpal bde ba chen po'i 'grel pa slob dpon chen po bi m'a la garbhas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The commentary on the glorious Great Bliss by the great master Vimalagarbha is complete.
